Ingest_LDD.name: Voyager Mission Submodel
Ingest_LDD.comment: v1.0.0.0 2022-05-04 Created by unifying the vg1 and vg2 namespace dictionaries, which will be deprecated. Specifically, the new base class Voyager contains elements common to both Voyager 1 and Voyager 2, and also contains exactly one of either the Voyager1 class or the Voyager2 class. The latter respectively contain elements relevant to only one of the two spacecraft. Also added new attributes and classes (TBD).

DD_Attribute.name: legacy_label_VICAR1
DD_Attribute.definition: The now-obsolete "VICAR-1" label that was originally attached to the image. To the extent possible, the information is captured in normal VICAR-2 and PDS4 labels. The labels are being retained for historical documentation purposes, and in case there is any question about how the rest of the label items were derived. Contemporaneous Voyager documentation sometimes refers to these legacy labels.

DD_Attribute.name: beam
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: companding
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: compression_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Whether the image compression mode was operating. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: @@@ I'm not sure what this would mean. @@@

DD_Attribute.name: data_anomaly_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Data recording anomalies in the image. If this keyword is missing [in the source data product], no anomalies were detected. DATA_ANOMALY_TYPE = RAM_DATA_CORRUPTION indicates that spurious values exist in the image data due to corruption of the random access memory onboard the spacecraft. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword DATA_ANOMALY_TYPE

DD_Attribute.name: dsn_station_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Name of the DSN station where the image was received Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: dsn_station_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Numeric ID of DSN station where the image was received Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: earth_received_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the image was received at Earth. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword EARTH_RECEIVED_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: edit_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Edit mode of the camera, indicates amount of data read from the vidicon. '1:1' indicates the full-resolution of the vidicon. Other values include '3:4', '1:2', '1:3', '1:5', and '1:10'. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword EDIT_MODE_ID

DD_Attribute.name: edr_file_number
DD_Attribute.definition: File number within the tape where the image was originally stored Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: edr_tape_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Tape ID on which the image was originally stored Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: elec_cal
DD_Attribute.definition: Electronics cal status Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: Time period during which the shutter was open Source Data Product Origin: Keyword EXPOSURE_DURATION

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_type
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: fds_scet_epoch_1
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft Event Time (SCET) for the first FDS count rollover epoch. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: fds_scet_epoch_2
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft Event Time (SCET) for the second FDS count rollover epoch. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: fds_scet_epoch_3
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft Event Time (SCET) for the third FDS count rollover epoch. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: fds_scet_epoch_4
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft Event Time (SCET) for the fourth FDS count rollover epoch. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: filter_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Optical filter used for the image. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword FILTER_NAME

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: NAC Filter #0 or #4 or WAC Filter #2, spanning portions of the Visible and Ultraviolet spectrum from 0.28 to 0.64 microns
NAC Filter #1 or WAC Filter #3, spanning portions of the Visible and Ultraviolet spectrum from 0.35 to 0.45 microns
NAC Filter #2 or WAC Filter #1, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.43 to 0.53 microns
NAC Filter #3 or WAC Filter #7, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.59 to 0.64 microns
NAC Filter #5 or #6 or WAC Filter #5, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.53 to 0.64 microns
NAC Filter #7, spanning portions of the Ultraviolet spectrum from 0.28 to 0.37 microns
WAC Filter #0, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.614 to 0.624 microns. Also called CH4_JS or METHANE-JST.
WAC Filter #0, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.588 to 0.590 microns. Also called NAD or SODIUM-D.
WAC Filter #6, spanning portions of the Visible spectrum from 0.536 to 0.546 microns. Also called CH4_U or METHANE-U.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Optical filter identification number, contains the unique number associated with the optical filter for the image. This value should correspond with that given in the definition of this label's value of filter_name. Despite the redundancy, it is retained here as it was in the source product label, for historical purposes. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword FILTER_NUMBER

DD_Attribute.name: filter_position
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: filter_step
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: flood
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: g1_voltage_count
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: gain_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The gain state of an instrument. Gain is a constant value, set by the observer, that indicates the approximate number of photon-excited electrons registered by the detector that correlate to one "data number" (DN). Source Data Product Origin: Keyword GAIN_MODE_ID

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The lower of the two gain states for Voyager ISS
The higher of the two gain states for Voyager ISS

DD_Attribute.name: geometry_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: image_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Image identification, takes the form: nnnnes+ddd, where 'nnnn' = picture sequence number for a given day, 'e' = planet of encounter (J=Jupiter, S=Saturn, U=Uranus, N=Neptune), 's' = Voyager spacecraft (1 or 2), - sign indicates before and a + sign indicates after closest planetary approach. 'ddd' = number of days from closest approach. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword IMAGE_ID

DD_Attribute.name: image_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Flight Data Subsystem (FDS) clock count at time of image acquisition. There is a unique IMAGE_NUMBER for each image in a planetary encounter. The clock count is always a seven digit value, five digits to the left of the decimal point and two digits to the right of the decimal point. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword IMAGE_NUMBER

DD_Attribute.name: image_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the image was acquired. The image_time element is duplicated from the source product label. It provides the time of shutter close calculated from spacecraft clock using both the coarse (seconds) and fine (subRTI) counters (UTC). (A subRTI is approximately 4 msec (1/256 second)). The value is identical to that given in start_time_doy, and start_date_time. Although it is redundant, it is retained here for historical reasons. When the shutter was inhibited (ie SHUTTER_STATE_ID=”DISABLED”), the IMAGE_TIME = START_TIME = STOP_TIME, and all three represent the start of the exposure window during the prepare cycle of the image. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword IMAGE_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: image_type
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: lsb_truncate
DD_Attribute.definition: Whether the LSB Truncation mode was operating. In this mode, only a certain number of the least significant bits are kept, while the bits corresponding to larger place values are truncated. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The LSB Truncate mode was off
The LSB Truncate mode was on
@@@ I'm not sure what this would mean. @@@

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Time period within the Voyager 1 or Voyager 2 mission, as defined by the mission team. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword MISSION_PHASE_NAME

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The day of launch. For Voyager 1 this is 1977-09-05. For Voyager 2 this is 1977-08-20.
The period of cruise from Earth to Jupiter. For Voyager 1 this is 1977-09-05 to 1979-01-06. For Voyager 2 this is 1977-08-20 to 1979-04-25.
The period surrounding the Jupiter Encounter. For Voyager 1 this is 1979-01-06 to 1979-04-13. For Voyager 2 this is 1979-04-25 to 1979-08-05.
The period of cruise from Jupiter to Saturn. For Voyager 1 this is 1979-04-13 to 1980-08-22. For Voyager 2 this is 1979-08-05 to 1981-06-05.
The period surrounding the Saturn Encounter. For Voyager 1 this is 1980-08-22 to 1980-12-14. For Voyager 2 this is 1981-06-05 to 1981-09-25.
The period of cruise from Saturn to Uranus. This does not apply to Voyager 1. For Voyager 2 this is 1981-09-25 to 1985-11-04
The period surrounding the Uranus Encounter. This does not apply to Voyager 1. For Voyager 2 this is 1985-11-04 to 1986-02-25.
The period of cruise from Uranus to Neptune. This does not apply to Voyager 1. For Voyager 2 this is 1986-02-25 to 1989-06-05.
The period surrounding the Neptune Encounter. This does not apply to Voyager 1. For Voyager 2 this is 1989-06-05 to 1989-10-02.
The period from the final planetary encounter to the end of the mission. For Voyager 1 this is 1980-12-14 to End of Mission. For Voyager 2 this is 1989-10-02 to End of Mission.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_dn_average_status
DD_Attribute.definition: Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_dn_average_threshold
DD_Attribute.definition: Average pixel value, in DN. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: scan_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Scan rate of vidicon readout. The instrument scan rate affects the radiometric properties of the camera because of the dark current buildup on the vidicon. Values can be '1:1', '2:1', '3:1', '5:1', and '10:1'. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword SCAN_MODE_ID

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Vidicon readout was at full speed.
Vidicon readout was at one-half speed.
Vidicon readout was at one-third speed.
Vidicon readout was at one-fifth speed.
Vidicon readout was at one-tenth speed.

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_close
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_exposure
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Shutter mode. Indicates which camera was shuttered, Narrow Angle and/or Wide Angle. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword SHUTTER_MODE_ID

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Neither the Narrow Angle nor the Wide Angle shutter opened
Only the Narrow Angle shutter opened
Only the Wide Angle shutter opened
Both the Narrow Angle and the Wide Angle shutters opened simultaneously
Shutter remained closed for Narrow Angle and Wide Angle cameras.

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_open
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_reset
DD_Attribute.definition: @@@ Need something here @@@ Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: signal_to_noise_ratio
DD_Attribute.definition: Signal-to-noise ratio as measured by the camera onboard. Original label parameter: SNR Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Attribute.name: source_product_description
DD_Attribute.definition: A description of the image, as recorded in the original source product label. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword DESCRIPTION

DD_Attribute.name: source_product_note
DD_Attribute.definition: The observational intent of the image, as recorded in the original source product label. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword NOTE

DD_Attribute.name: source_product_target_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The value of TARGET_NAME as given in the source product label. The relationship between this value and the actual intentions of the observer is unknown. The most accurate, though potentially flawed identification of the intended target is given in the Target_Identification class elsewhere in the label. This attribute is included in the PDS4 label for historical reasons. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword TARGET_NAME

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The Voyager spacecraft clock, known as the Flight Data System (FDS), was reset to zero multiple times, dividing each mission into four partitions. This attribute signifies which partition was in effect for this data product. Source Data Product Origin: @@@ Need something here @@@

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft clock value at the beginning of a time period of interest. Voyager used the term Flight Data System (FDS) for this quantity, which is equivalent to the term spacecraft clock (SCLK) more commonly used by subsequent missions. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword SPACECRAFT_CLOCK_START_COUNT

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft clock value at the end of a time period of interest. Voyager used the term Flight Data System (FDS) for this quantity, which is equivalent to the term spacecraft clock (SCLK) more commonly used by subsequent missions. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword SPACECRAFT_CLOCK_STOP_COUNT

DD_Attribute.name: start_time_doy
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the shutter opened, if given in year-day-of-year format. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword START_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: start_time_ymd
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the shutter opened, if given in year-month-day format. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword START_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: stop_time_doy
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the shutter closed, if given in year-day-of-year format. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword STOP_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: stop_time_ymd
DD_Attribute.definition: Time at which the shutter closed, if given in year-month-day format. Source Data Product Origin: Keyword STOP_TIME

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The mode within the Voyager ISS instrument of telemetry between the detector and the tape recorder. Source Data Product Origin: Legacy Header

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: This keyword had no value in the original label. Meaning unclear.

DD_Class.name: Voyager
DD_Class.definition: Elements relevant to the Voyager 1 and/or Voyager 2 spacecraft mission.

DD_Class.name: ISS
DD_Class.definition: Attributes relevant to the Voyager Imaging Science Subsystem (ISS) instrument and its observations.

DD_Class.name: Image_State
DD_Class.definition: Information about an image taken by the Voyager Imaging Science Subsystem (ISS) instrument.

DD_Class.name: Image_Description
DD_Class.definition: Attributes describing an image taken by the Voyager Imaging Science Subsystem (ISS) instrument.

DD_Class.name: Voyager_Telemetry
DD_Class.definition: Container for elements describing the process of transferring Voyager data from the spacecraft to Earth.

DD_Class.name: Voyager_Timing
DD_Class.definition: Container for elements describing the time at which a data product was obtained
